body_html:
I did not explain myself right. sess.run([a]) and sess.run(a) are same in my example, just tested this. Creating

a = epoch[0]
sess.run(a,train_step_run)

also works fine. a is a tensor object.

The thing that would not work is:
sess.run(a[0])
or
sess.run([a[0]])
body_text:
I did not explain myself right. sess.run([a]) and sess.run(a) are same in my example, just tested this. Creating
a = epoch[0]

body:
I did not explain myself right. sess.run([a]) and sess.run(a) are same in my example, just tested this. Creating 
```
a = epoch[0]
sess.run(a,train_step_run) 
```
also works fine. a is a tensor object. 

The thing that would not work is:
`sess.run(a[0]) `
or 
`sess.run([a[0]])`
